rounds.name: Online Assessment
points: 2-3 questions on Linux commands, scripting, and DevOps concepts
Common topics: Bash scripting, Docker commands, CI/CD workflows
May include MCQs on networking, cloud basics, and infrastructure
Time management is key - demonstrate practical DevOps knowledge

rounds.name: Practical DevOps Round
points: Set up a CI/CD pipeline from scratch (e.g., deploy app with Jenkins/GitHub Actions)
Focus on working automation, proper Dockerfile, and deployment strategy
Demonstrate knowledge of containers, networking, and basic orchestration
Working deployment matters more than perfect optimization

rounds.name: Technical Interview (Infrastructure)
points: Questions on Linux administration, networking, and cloud concepts
Explain concepts: containers vs VMs, load balancers, DNS, SSL/TLS
Live problem-solving: debug deployment failures, troubleshoot services
May include scripting tasks (write Bash/Python for automation)

rounds.name: Technical Interview (Tools & Automation)
points: Deep dive into CI/CD tools: Jenkins, GitLab CI, GitHub Actions
Questions on Docker, Docker Compose, and Kubernetes basics
Infrastructure as Code: Terraform or Ansible fundamentals
Build or debug a simple automation workflow and explain choices

rounds.name: Hiring Manager / Cultural Fit
points: Discussion about past projects and your contributions to deployments
Behavioral questions on teamwork, problem-solving, and learning
Why DevOps and why this company? Show genuine interest
Ask thoughtful questions about team structure and tech stack

easy: Keep practicing DevOps automation regularly to stay sharp

doable: DevOps fundamentals are essential - Docker, Kubernetes, CI/CD
Master cloud platforms and infrastructure as code (Terraform)
Prepare for hands-on practical rounds with timed practice
challenging: Strong cloud and container orchestration knowledge is mandatory
Deep understanding of Kubernetes, monitoring, and production systems
Referrals significantly improve your chances - start networking
stretch: This requires 6-8 months of focused preparation and practice
Infrastructure and automation mastery is non-negotiable

projects.title: Simple CI/CD Pipeline with GitHub Actions
projects.description: Build an automated CI/CD pipeline for a Node.js/Python app with testing, Docker build, and deployment
projects.shortDescription: Automated pipeline with testing and Docker deployment
projects.fullDescription: Create a complete CI/CD workflow using GitHub Actions that automatically tests code, builds Docker images, and deploys to a cloud platform. This project teaches fundamental DevOps concepts: version control, automated testing, containerization, and continuous deployment - all essential skills for entry-level DevOps roles.

implementationSteps.title: Set Up Application & Dockerfile
implementationSteps.description: Create a simple Node.js or Python web application with basic tests (Jest/pytest). Write a multi-stage Dockerfile optimized for production: use official base images, minimize layers, and implement proper caching. Test the Docker build locally with docker build and docker run to ensure it works correctly.

implementationSteps.title: Create GitHub Actions Workflow
implementationSteps.description: In .github/workflows/, create a YAML workflow file that triggers on push to main branch. Define jobs: (1) Run tests with appropriate test framework, (2) Build Docker image if tests pass, (3) Push image to Docker Hub or GitHub Container Registry. Use actions like actions/checkout, docker/build-push-action for efficient builds.

implementationSteps.title: Implement Secrets Management
implementationSteps.description: Add GitHub Secrets for sensitive data: Docker Hub credentials, cloud provider access keys, API tokens. Reference secrets in workflow using ${{ secrets.SECRET_NAME }} syntax. Implement environment-specific configurations using GitHub Environments (dev, staging, production) with different secret values.

implementationSteps.title: Add Deployment Stage
implementationSteps.description: Extend workflow to deploy containerized app to AWS EC2, Azure App Service, or DigitalOcean. Use SSH actions to connect to server, pull latest Docker image, and restart container. Alternatively, deploy to managed services like AWS ECS, Azure Container Instances, or Google Cloud Run for simpler setup.

implementationSteps.title: Add Monitoring & Notifications
implementationSteps.description: Implement workflow notifications: send Slack/Discord message on deployment success or failure. Add health check step after deployment to verify app is running. Create a status badge in README showing build status. Document the entire CI/CD process with architecture diagram and setup instructions.

projects.title: Kubernetes Cluster Deployment with Monitoring
projects.description: Deploy a multi-container application on Kubernetes with Prometheus monitoring, Grafana dashboards, and auto-scaling
projects.shortDescription: Kubernetes deployment with monitoring and auto-scaling
projects.fullDescription: Build a production-ready Kubernetes deployment for a microservices application. Implement proper configurations with ConfigMaps and Secrets, set up Prometheus and Grafana for monitoring, configure horizontal pod autoscaling based on metrics, and expose services with Ingress. This project demonstrates container orchestration expertise essential for modern DevOps roles.

implementationSteps.title: Set Up Kubernetes Cluster
implementationSteps.description: Create a local Kubernetes cluster using Minikube or kind for development. Alternatively, provision a managed cluster on AWS EKS, GKE, or Azure AKS. Verify cluster connectivity with kubectl cluster-info and kubectl get nodes. Organize your Kubernetes manifests in folders: deployments/, services/, configmaps/, monitoring/.

implementationSteps.title: Create Application Deployments
implementationSteps.description: Write Deployment manifests for your microservices (e.g., frontend, backend, database). Define resource limits and requests for CPU and memory. Create Service manifests (ClusterIP for internal, LoadBalancer/NodePort for external access). Implement liveness and readiness probes for health checking. Use ConfigMaps for environment variables and Secrets for sensitive data.

implementationSteps.title: Deploy Prometheus & Grafana
implementationSteps.description: Install Prometheus using Helm chart or kubectl apply with YAML manifests. Configure ServiceMonitors to scrape metrics from your application pods. Deploy Grafana and connect it to Prometheus data source. Create dashboards showing pod CPU/memory usage, request rates, and error rates. Set up persistent volumes for data retention.

implementationSteps.title: Implement Auto-Scaling
implementationSteps.description: Install metrics-server in the cluster for resource metrics collection. Create HorizontalPodAutoscaler (HPA) for your deployments based on CPU/memory utilization (e.g., scale when CPU > 70%). Test auto-scaling by generating load with tools like Apache Bench or hey. Monitor scaling behavior in Grafana dashboards and verify pods scale up and down correctly.

implementationSteps.title: Configure Ingress & Finalize
implementationSteps.description: Install an Ingress controller (nginx-ingress or traefik) in your cluster. Create Ingress resources to route external traffic to services based on hostnames or paths. Configure SSL/TLS with cert-manager for HTTPS (optional but recommended). Add alerts in Prometheus for critical conditions (pod crashes, high memory, service down). Document the architecture, deployment process, and monitoring setup with screenshots.

projects.title: Multi-Cloud Infrastructure with Terraform
projects.description: Build complete cloud infrastructure using Terraform with VPC, EC2, RDS, load balancers, auto-scaling, and monitoring
projects.shortDescription: Production-grade IaC with Terraform for AWS/Azure
projects.fullDescription: Design and provision a complete production environment using Infrastructure as Code with Terraform. Create modular, reusable Terraform code for networking (VPC, subnets), compute (EC2 with auto-scaling), databases (RDS), load balancing, and security groups. Implement state management with remote backends, use workspaces for multiple environments, and integrate with CI/CD. This advanced project showcases infrastructure automation expertise highly valued at top companies.

implementationSteps.title: Design Infrastructure Architecture
implementationSteps.description: Plan the complete infrastructure: VPC with public/private subnets across multiple availability zones, internet gateway, NAT gateways, route tables. Design security groups for web tier (allow 80/443), app tier (internal only), and database tier (restricted access). Choose instance types, RDS engine (PostgreSQL/MySQL), and auto-scaling policies. Create architecture diagram showing all components and their relationships.

implementationSteps.title: Set Up Terraform Project Structure
implementationSteps.description: Organize Terraform code with modules: modules/vpc, modules/compute, modules/database, modules/networking. Create environments: dev, staging, prod using workspaces or separate state files. Set up remote state backend using S3 + DynamoDB (AWS) or Azure Storage for state locking. Define variables.tf for configurable parameters (region, instance type, CIDR blocks) and outputs.tf for resource details.

implementationSteps.title: Build Networking & Security
implementationSteps.description: Write Terraform modules for VPC with public and private subnets. Create internet gateway for public subnets and NAT gateways for private subnet internet access. Define security groups with least privilege: web tier allows 80/443 from internet, app tier accepts traffic only from web tier, RDS only from app tier. Implement network ACLs for additional security layer.

implementationSteps.title: Provision Compute & Database
implementationSteps.description: Create EC2 launch template with user data script to install application dependencies. Set up auto-scaling group with min/max instances and scaling policies (CPU > 75% scale out). Deploy application load balancer (ALB) distributing traffic to EC2 instances with health checks. Provision RDS instance in private subnet with multi-AZ for high availability, automated backups, and encryption at rest.

implementationSteps.title: Add Monitoring, CI/CD & Documentation
implementationSteps.description: Enable CloudWatch monitoring for EC2, ALB, and RDS with alarms for high CPU, memory, or database connections. Create CloudWatch dashboard showing infrastructure health. Implement Terraform in CI/CD: validate on PR, plan on merge, apply on manual approval. Use terraform fmt, terraform validate, and tflint for code quality. Add comprehensive README with architecture diagram, prerequisites, deployment steps, and cost estimates.

implementationSteps.title: Implement Disaster Recovery & Cost Optimization
implementationSteps.description: Set up RDS automated backups with 7-day retention and snapshot before major changes. Implement cross-region replication for critical data. Add lifecycle policies for S3 buckets (move to Glacier after 30 days). Use spot instances for non-critical workloads in auto-scaling groups. Tag all resources for cost allocation and implement AWS Budgets alerts. Create destroy and rebuild scripts for easy environment management.
